program.title: TITM Trader Development Program
program.description: Competency-based program for options execution, risk, and review discipline

modules.title: Market Context Fundamentals
modules.description: Learn to identify session context before entering risk.
learningOutcomes: Classify trend, range, and transition sessions
Select setups aligned to session context

lessons.title: Session Framing for Options
lessons.learningObjective: Build a repeatable pre-trade context checklist before opening a position.

blocks.title: SPX Open: Range to Trend Transition
Tag Context From a Chart Snapshot

lessons.title: Invalidations and Key Levels
lessons.learningObjective: Mark invalidation and target levels that define whether a trade remains valid.

modules.title: Risk and Execution Discipline
modules.description: Translate setup quality into size, management, and disciplined exits.
learningOutcomes: Size positions by invalidation distance and account risk
Plan scale-out and hard-stop behavior before entry
Use post-trade reflection to reduce repeat mistakes

lessons.title: Position Sizing With Invalidation
lessons.learningObjective: Compute position size from account risk and invalidation distance.

blocks.title: Why Good Setups Still Blow Up Accounts
Sizing Two Contracts Across Volatility Regimes
Size the Trade in Three Scenarios
When to Reduce Size Despite Strong Conviction

lessons.title: Exit Discipline Under Pressure
lessons.learningObjective: Execute pre-defined exits consistently when trades move quickly.

blocks.title: Most PnL Damage Happens After Entry
Three Exit Triggers You Must Define
Fast Reversal: Stick to Plan or Hope
Choose Exits for Four Replay Segments
Which Bias Broke Your Last Exit?
